page.title: 10SEWALDS HALL FARM
page.content: SEWALDS HALL FARM:{495074.}is mentioned in the Domesday Book. The central area of the house was destroyed around 1885. Three generations of the Furze family have farmed here although they originated in Somerset. There are two employees who live in tied cottages as do three other retired farm workers. Prior to 1977 this was a dairy farm with 100 head of Friesian/Canadian Holstein cross-bred cows. This is one of the few local farms to retain livestock with arable farming. At present, 30 young bullocks are bought in for fattening, and sold after 18 months. The dominant crops are oilseed rape; feed-wheat; and barley. Much of the wheat & barley is used for local livestock feed and the balance is sold to animal food processing concerns.
